content.user_title: Add animations to React with Framer Motion
content.value_statement: Create engaging user interfaces with smooth animations. This skill provides ready-to-use code patterns for hover effects, page transitions, scroll animations, and complex gesture interactions in React and Next.js applications.
actual_capabilities: Create motion components with initial, animate, and exit states
Build coordinated animations using variants with stagger effects
Implement hover, tap, drag, and pan gestures on UI elements
Add scroll-triggered animations using whileInView and useScroll
Create page transitions with AnimatePresence for route changes
Build draggable lists with Reorder component for reordering
limitations: Does not include animation performance testing tools
Does not generate animation assets or design files

output: Use whileHover for scale up effect (1.05 scale)
Use whileTap for press effect (0.95 scale)
Apply spring transition for natural feel
Combine with background color changes for visual feedback

best_practices: Use variants for complex coordinated animations to keep code organized
Respect user preferences by checking useReducedMotion before animating
Keep page transitions under 500ms for better user experience
Prefer GPU-accelerated properties like opacity and transform over layout changes
anti_patterns: Avoid animating expensive properties like width, height, or top/left repeatedly
Do not skip exit animations when removing elements from the DOM
Avoid excessive layout prop usage as it can impact performance on large lists
Do not use fixed durations for all animations; prefer springs for interactions

faq.question: Which React frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Framer Motion works with any React framework including Next.js, Create React App, Vite, and Remix.

faq.question: What is the performance impact of animations?
faq.answer: Framer Motion uses GPU-accelerated transforms. Avoid animating layout properties on large lists.

faq.question: How do I integrate with Next.js App Router?
faq.answer: Use template.tsx with AnimatePresence for route transitions. Wrap page content in motion components.

faq.question: Does this skill access any external services?
faq.answer: No. This skill is pure documentation. It generates code locally without network calls or data collection.

faq.question: Why are my exit animations not working?
faq.answer: Exit animations require AnimatePresence wrapper around elements that will be removed from the DOM.

faq.question: How is this different from CSS animations?
faq.answer: Framer Motion provides imperative control, gesture recognition, scroll linking, and physics-based springs.
